definition: in the ordinary course of events/ordinarily/normally
to press/to push/to leave aside or shelve/to control/to restrain/to keep one's hand on/to check or refer to/according to/in the light of/(of an editor or author) to make a comment
to persuade
to speak/to say/to explain/to scold/to tell off/a theory (typically the last character in a compound, as in 日心說|日心说 heliocentric theory)
variant of 說|说[shuo1]

sentences.english: Ordinarily it should be snowing at this time of the year.
Ordinarily they were able to rack up all the other teams without the lightest effort.
sentences.chinese: 按说他们可以毫不费劲地击败其他各队。

sentences.english: Ordinarily, you want to trade all the time.
sentences.chinese: 按说，你想要的一切贸易。

sentences.english: Tell truth , Ordinarily my life should be very pleased .
sentences.chinese: 说实话，按说我的生活应该过得很惬意。

sentences.english: It is thought that whoever she crowns will be the next to wed.
sentences.chinese: 按说，获得金冠的女子就是下一个要结婚的人。

sentences.english: They should be at the airport by now.
sentences.chinese: 按说他们现在应当已经到机场了。

sentences.english: "Don't fight the People's Bank" says that's the right strategy now.
sentences.chinese: “别和人民银行作对”按说是目前的良策。

definition: according to reason/in the ordinary course of events/normally
it may be assumed that
moreover/besides/in addition/furthermore
let alone/to say nothing of/besides/what's more
to believe (sth in relation to oneself)/to regard oneself as/to acknowledge (sth in relation to oneself)/to resign oneself to
in my opinion
common sense/conventional reasoning and morals
returning to our main topic,.../that said,.../again,.../in this connection/in passing/nevertheless,.../anyhow
to seem/to appear/(in a negative or interrogative sentence) to be sure
perhaps
good and bad/most unfortunate occurrence/in any case/whatever

(indicates that sth turns out just the opposite of what one would wish) unfortunately/as it happened/(indicates that sth is the opposite of what would be normal or reasonable) stubbornly/contrarily/against reason/(indicates that sb or a group is singled out) precisely/only/of all people
to calculate/to estimate/in total/all told/(fig.) if you think about it
certainly
to be honest, ...
most/mostly/most likely
